response:
Urgent magnetic resonance imaging is the gold standard to visualize the spinal cord lesion and distinguish between compressive (requiring surgery) and intrinsic (medical) causes. Contrast is necessary to identify active inflammation or tumours. Brain imaging screens for dissemination in time and space (demyelination).
